object:
64-bit integers as built-in Lua library registered with int64 name. No need to require it.
You have 3 ways to create int64 numbers:
#n -- from number, shortcut for int64.new(n) int64.new(n) -- from number int64.new(s) -- from string To convert them back to Lua built-in types:
num() -- to number num"" -- to string To get and set single bits:
num[i] num[i] = b All operators are supported including new bitwise ones as for Lua double numbers. android ios mac pc html5 winrt win32 Create 64 bit integer value to use as 64 bit integer
